title: 1989–90 Rugby Football League season
text:
The 1989–90 <a href="Rugby%20Football%20League">Rugby Football League</a> season was the 95th ever season of professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> football in Britain. Fourteen teams competed from August, 1989 until May, 1990 for the <a href="Stones%20Bitter">Stones Bitter</a> <a href="Rugby%20Football%20League%20Championship">Championship</a>, Premiership Trophy and <a href="Silk%20Cut">Silk Cut</a> <a href="Challenge%20Cup">Challenge Cup</a>.
Season summary.
<a href="Warrington%20Wolves">Warrington</a> beat <a href="Oldham%20R.L.F.C.">Oldham</a> 24–16 to win the <a href="RFL%20Lancashire%20Cup">Lancashire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20cups">County Cup</a>, and <a href="Bradford%20Bulls">Bradford Northern</a> beat <a href="Featherstone%20Rovers">Featherstone Rovers</a> 20–14 to win the <a href="RFL%20Yorkshire%20Cup">Yorkshire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20cups">County Cup</a>.
League Tables.
<a href="Liverpool%20Stanley">Runcorn Highfield</a> became only the second peacetime team in the history of the Rugby Football League to <a href="imperfect%20season">lose every game</a>, and the first since Liverpool City in 1906-1907.
Challenge Cup.
Wigan defeated Warrington 36-14 in the <a href="Challenge%20Cup">Challenge Cup</a> Final at <a href="Wembley%20Stadium%20%281923%29">Wembley Stadium</a> on Saturday 28 April 1990 before a crowd of 77,729. <a href="Andy%20Gregory">Andy Gregory</a>, Wigan's scrum half, was awarded his second <a href="Lance%20Todd%20Trophy">Lance Todd Trophy</a> for being the man-of-the-match.
